body_html: The Tensor C++ class unconditionally stores the shape on the CPU regardless of where the data is, and essentially everything assumes this (for error detection, branching, etc.). I think there's very little chance this situation will change.
body_text: The Tensor C++ class unconditionally stores the shape on the CPU regardless of where the data is, and essentially everything assumes this (for error detection, branching, etc.).  I think there's very little chance this situation will change.
body: The `Tensor` C++ class unconditionally stores the shape on the CPU regardless of where the data is, and essentially everything assumes this (for error detection, branching, etc.).  I think there's very little chance this situation will change.
